title: Is there a difference between gg and GG?
body:
I have seen the occasional post about how confusing gg can be since there have historically been two meanings to it:
Good Game
Get Good [Git Gud, if you're grammatically challenged]

So I am posting a survey post to get the communities' take on the issue.

replies.body: The only real difference is whether or not they held shift/capslock.
I've never seen someone attempt to use "gg" or "GG" for "Get good".
The shortcut for "get good" is "git gud". Everyone knows that!
What about in the instance of "gg ez"

The "gg" still stands for "good game" in that scenario, just as it does in it's counterpart "gg no re". Both are on the bad sportsmanship side of things, yet I've never heard someone attempt to claim they stood for anything other than "good game".

They both could mean either or, but I generally see gg to mean good/great game.
People usually use get/git good/gud to BM, and they want you to know they're trying to BM so they just spell it out... you know.. just so you know they're being rude.

The difference between "gg" and "GG" is not a common knowledge thing. "Gg" regardless of capitalization or not is always assumed to be mean "good game."

"Git gud" is the general accepted abbreviation for "get good" on online platforms.

gg = good game
GG = good game (with bm)
